intro: Lintonia nutans var. melicoides, commonly known as the spreading lintonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
